title: MIT-Pillar AI Collective announces first seed grant recipients
summary: The MIT-Pillar AI Collective has announced its first six grant recipients. The program, funded by a $1 million gift from Pillar VC, aims to support students, alumni, and postdocs working on AI, machine learning, and data science projects that have the potential to be commercially viable. The grants will help these individuals explore the commercial applications of their research and potentially create startups. The recipients will receive funding, mentorship, and guidance, as well as access to resources and support for market research, customer discovery, and prototyping. The projects range from a predictive query interface for time series databases to the design of light-activated drugs and low-cost 3D perception technology. The program also organizes community events and provides opportunities for networking and collaboration.
